intro: Rhagodia parabolica var. reclinata, commonly known as the reclining burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny fruits that are adapted for seed dispersal by animals. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in plant taxonomy.
